task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for Ali Khaledi Nasab artificial intelligence researcher profile and current employment
task_1.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab is a physicist and artificial intelligence (AI) scientist currently employed at Amazon Rufus, where he focuses on developing generative AI products. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai)) Originally from Iran, he moved to the United States in 2014 to pursue a Ph.D. in physics at Ohio University. After completing his doctorate, he held a research position in the Department of Neurosurgery at Stanford University School of Medicine. Subsequently, he joined CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on treatments for epilepsy. In October 2022, he became a research scientist at Amazon Web Services (AWS) in the Network Capacity Planning organization. In 2024, he transitioned to Amazon Rufus to work on generative AI products. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

Dr. Khaledi-Nasab's expertise spans physics, neuroscience, machine learning, deep learning, nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences. He is committed to continuous learning, dedicating two hours daily to reading and coursework. In 2024, he was appointed as an Adjunct Professor of Physics at Ohio University and delivered a colloquium talk at the university's Department of Physics. Additionally, he served as the editor for the Brain Development section of the "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health," which received the 2024 PROSE Award for significant contributions in Clinical Medicine. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Dr. Khaledi-Nasab maintains a personal website at [alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/), where he shares updates on his professional journey and research interests. He also has a Medium blog, though it has limited content. ([ali-khaledi1989.medium.com](https://ali-khaledi1989.medium.com/?utm_source=openai))

While a specific LinkedIn profile for Dr. Khaledi-Nasab was not found in the provided search results, his personal website and Medium blog offer comprehensive information about his background and current endeavors.

task_2.query_used: Search Google Scholar and ResearchGate for publications by Ali Khaledi Nasab in AI and machine learning
task_2.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab is a researcher affiliated with Amazon, specializing in machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. His work encompasses a range of topics, including the application of machine learning in neuroscience and the study of network dynamics.

One of his notable contributions is the study titled "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge," published in *Scientific Reports* in 2022. This research investigates methods to reduce polarization in social networks by introducing random dynamical interventions, demonstrating how such nudges can effectively disrupt echo chambers and promote diverse viewpoints.

In the realm of computational neuroscience, Khaledi-Nasab co-authored "Long-lasting desynchronization of plastic neural networks by random reset stimulation," published in *Frontiers in Physiology* in 2021. This study explores techniques for inducing sustained desynchronization in neural networks, which has potential therapeutic implications for neurological disorders characterized by pathological synchronization.

Additionally, his work "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements," published in *Scientific Reports* in 2017, examines the emergence of stochastic oscillations in hierarchical networks of excitable elements, contributing to the understanding of signal processing in complex networks.

These publications highlight Khaledi-Nasab's interdisciplinary approach, applying machine learning and AI methodologies to address complex problems in network dynamics and neuroscience.

task_3.query_used: Search IEEE Xplore and ACM Digital Library for academic papers authored by Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_3.data:
I was unable to access IEEE Xplore and ACM Digital Library directly due to restrictions, but I gathered information from other reputable sources about Dr. Ali Khaledi-Nasab's academic contributions.

Dr. Khaledi-Nasab has authored 23 papers, accumulating 426 citations, with an h-index of 10 and a g-index of 21. ([exaly.com](https://exaly.com/author/5034433/ali-khaledi-nasab?utm_source=openai))

His research spans several areas, including machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

Notable publications include:

- "Potato extract as reducing agent and stabiliser in a facile green one-step synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles," which explores a green synthesis method for ZnO nanoparticles using potato extract. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

- "Long-Lasting Desynchronization of Plastic Neural Networks by Random Reset Stimulation," focusing on desynchronization techniques in neural networks. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

Dr. Khaledi-Nasab is currently a Senior Researcher at Amazon in Seattle, United States, and a Researcher at the Ronin Institute in Essex County, United States. ([loop.frontiersin.org](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/publications?utm_source=openai))

For a comprehensive list of his publications, you can visit his Google Scholar profile. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

task_4.query_used: Search GitHub and GitLab for code repositories and projects by Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_4.data:
I couldn't locate any public code repositories or projects by Ali Khaledi Nasab on GitHub or GitLab. However, his personal website provides a comprehensive overview of his professional journey and research contributions. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. Originally from Iran, he moved to the United States in 2014 to pursue a Ph.D. in physics and astronomy at Ohio University. After completing his doctorate, he joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery for a research position. Following his tenure at Stanford, he worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on developing treatments for epilepsy. Due to funding challenges, CODA closed its doors, leading him to his current role at Amazon. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Throughout his career, Ali has engaged in interdisciplinary research, combining physics, neuroscience, and artificial intelligence. His work includes studies on nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences. Notably, he has contributed to the development of stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders, such as Parkinson's disease, and has explored the dynamics of phase oscillator networks with synaptic weight and structural plasticity. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

In addition to his research, Ali maintains a blog titled "Ali's Notes," where he shares his thoughts on various topics, including book recommendations and advice for future graduate students and postdocs. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/alis-notes?utm_source=openai))

For a detailed list of his publications and citations, you can refer to his Google Scholar profile. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

While there are no public code repositories available, Ali's extensive research and professional experiences are well-documented through his personal website and academic profiles.

citations.title: Ali Khaledi, Ph. D. - Ali's Notes

task_5.data: Based on the available information, there is no evidence to suggest that Dr. Ali Khaledi Nasab has any academic affiliations with institutions in Oman. His professional journey includes positions in the United States, such as a research role at Stanford University's School of Medicine and a scientist position at Amazon. His academic background comprises a Ph.D. in Physics & Astronomy from Ohio University, where he engaged in research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai)) Furthermore, his publication record, as listed on his Google Scholar profile, does not indicate any collaborations or affiliations with Omani institutions. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

task_6.query_used: Search Oman company registries and business directories for Ali Khaledi Nasab as director or shareholder
task_6.data:
After searching available Omani company registries and business directories, I did not find any information indicating that Ali Khaledi Nasab holds a position as a director or shareholder in any Omani company. The sources consulted include the Oman American Business Council Member Directory ([oabc.org](https://oabc.org/directory/?utm_source=openai)), Dun & Bradstreet company profiles ([dnb.com](https://www.dnb.com/business-directory/company-profiles.khalid_bin_ali_alsaadi_and_partner.d474dbedd05197a04a00cbc6f791f4de.html?utm_source=openai)), Oman Product Finder ([omanproductfinder.com](https://www.omanproductfinder.com/category-list/3?utm_source=openai)), and various business directories ([scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/doc/313425138/Oman-Yellow-Pages?utm_source=openai), [scribd.com](https://www.scribd.com/doc/291274211/OMAN-Companies-Contact-Details?utm_source=openai), [omanbusinesscard.com](https://omanbusinesscard.com/search/?utm_source=openai), [omanyellowpagesonline.com](https://omanyellowpagesonline.com/companies.htm?utm_source=openai)).

Please note that the absence of information in these sources does not conclusively confirm that Ali Khaledi Nasab has no affiliations with Omani companies. Some companies may not be listed in public directories, or their records may not be up to date. For more comprehensive and authoritative information, you may consider contacting the Omani Ministry of Commerce, Industry, and Investment Promotion or consulting legal professionals specializing in Omani corporate law.

task_8.query_used: Search AI conference proceedings and speaker lists for Ali Khaledi Nasab presentations
task_8.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab has actively contributed to the field of physics through various presentations and publications. In October 2017, as a graduate student at Ohio University, he delivered a colloquium titled "Emergent Stochastic Oscillations and Signal Detection in Tree Networks of Excitable Elements" at the College of Wooster. His talk focused on the stochastic dynamics of tree networks of excitable elements, relevant to certain sensory neurons, and proposed mechanisms for tuning the activity of central elements in these networks. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

In March 2019, Khaledi-Nasab received a Student Travel Award from the American Physical Society's Division of Biological Physics, enabling him to present his research at the APS annual meeting in Boston. His presentation, "Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks: Application to Sensory Neurons," delved into the dynamical principles of sensory neurons with tree-like morphologies, such as those found in muscle spindles and mechanoreceptors. He utilized theoretical and computational approaches to explore spike generation and information coding in these neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

Beyond these presentations, Khaledi-Nasab has an extensive publication record, with 23 papers and 426 citations, reflecting his significant contributions to the field. ([exaly.com](https://exaly.com/author/5034433/ali-khaledi-nasab?utm_source=openai))

Currently, he serves as a Senior Researcher at Amazon in Seattle and is also affiliated with the Ronin Institute in Essex County, United States. ([loop.frontiersin.org](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/bio?utm_source=openai))

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Gives Colloquium Talk at College of Wooster - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

Dr. Khaledi Nasab maintains a personal website where he shares his professional journey, research interests, and personal notes. For direct contact or to follow his updates, Dr. Khaledi Nasab provides contact information on his website. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/contact-ali?utm_source=openai))

task_12.query_used: Search ResearchGate and ORCID for collaboration networks and citation metrics of Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_12.data:
I couldn't locate specific profiles for Ali Khaledi Nasab on ResearchGate or ORCID based on the available information. It's possible that he may not have active profiles on these platforms, or his profiles are not publicly accessible.

In general, platforms like ResearchGate and ORCID are valuable for analyzing researchers' collaboration networks and citation metrics. ResearchGate allows users to view co-authorship connections, publication counts, and citation statistics, providing insights into a researcher's collaborative relationships and academic impact. ORCID offers a unique identifier for researchers, enabling the consolidation of their work across various platforms and databases, which facilitates the tracking of their scholarly output and collaborations.

For a comprehensive analysis of Ali Khaledi Nasab's collaboration networks and citation metrics, it would be beneficial to access his profiles on these platforms directly. If such profiles are unavailable, alternative approaches include searching for his publications in academic databases like Scopus or Web of Science, which often provide co-authorship information and citation counts.

report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 11, 2025

### Executive Summary

Ali Khaledi-Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently employed at Amazon Rufus, focusing on generative AI products. He holds a Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University and has prior research experience at Stanford University School of Medicine and CODA Biotherapeutics.  He has a strong academic background with publications and presentations in physics, machine learning, and related fields.  No red flags were identified in the available OSINT data.

### Thematic Summary of Key Findings

**Professional / Career Background**

* Currently employed as an AI scientist at Amazon Rufus, working on generative AI products.
* Previously a research scientist at Amazon in the AWS network capacity team.
* Held a research position in the Department of Neurosurgery at Stanford University School of Medicine.
* Worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on treatments for epilepsy.


**Business & Financial Activity**

* No business ownership or financial affiliations were discovered in the available OSINT data, beyond his employment history.

**Legal or Criminal Mentions**

* No mentions of legal or criminal activity were found.

**Academic / Public Recognition**

* Ph.D. in Physics & Astronomy from Ohio University (2019). Research focused on the dynamics of excitable tree networks.
* Authored 23 papers with 426 citations, h-index of 10, and g-index of 21.  Research areas include machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics.
* Presented a colloquium titled "Emergent Stochastic Oscillations and Signal Detection in Tree Networks of Excitable Elements" at the College of Wooster in October 2017.
* Received an APS travel award to attend a conference (May 2019).

**Online / Social Presence**

* Maintains a personal website: [alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai)
* Presence on Frontiers Loop research network: [loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/bio](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/bio?utm_source=openai)
* No verified presence found on Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram.
* Listed as an author on Amazon Science: [amazon.science/author/ali-khaledi](https://www.amazon.science/author/ali-khaledi?utm_source=openai)

**Other Notable Mentions**

* Originally from Iran, moved to the United States in 2014.
* Publication: "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge" in *Scientific Reports* (2022).


### Risk Profile

Based on the available OSINT data, Ali Khaledi-Nasab presents a **low reputational risk**.  He has a consistent and positive professional trajectory, a strong academic background, and no indications of concerning activities.

flagged_issues: Minor inconsistency: Report states 'no verified presence found on Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram' but evidence shows search was conducted but couldn't locate accounts - subtle but important distinction
Missing citation for 'Depolarization of echo chambers' publication mentioned in thematic summary
No evidence provided for 'low reputational risk' assessment - this is an inference not directly supported by retrieval data
Report could benefit from more specific citations throughout to track information provenance
judgement.revised_report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 11, 2025

### Executive Summary

Ali Khaledi-Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently employed at Amazon Rufus, focusing on generative AI products¹. He holds a Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University (2019)² and has prior research experience at Stanford University School of Medicine and CODA Biotherapeutics¹. He has a strong academic background with 23 publications, 426 citations, h-index of 10, and g-index of 21³. No concerning activities or red flags were identified in the available OSINT data.

### Thematic Summary of Key Findings

**Professional / Career Background**

* Currently employed as an AI scientist at Amazon Rufus, working on generative AI products (as of 2024)¹
* Previously a research scientist at Amazon AWS network capacity planning organization (October 2022)¹
* Held a research position in the Department of Neurosurgery at Stanford University School of Medicine¹
* Worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on treatments for epilepsy¹
* Also affiliated with the Ronin Institute in Essex County, United States⁸
* Appointed as Adjunct Professor of Physics at Ohio University (2024)¹

**Business & Financial Activity**

* No business ownership or financial affiliations were discovered in available OSINT data⁶
* No directorship or shareholding positions found in Omani company registries⁶

**Legal or Criminal Mentions**

* No mentions of legal or criminal activity were found in any searched sources.

**Academic / Public Recognition**

* Ph.D. in Physics & Astronomy from Ohio University (2019), research focused on dynamics of excitable tree networks⁵
* 23 papers with 426 citations, h-index of 10, and g-index of 21³
* Research areas include machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics²
* Presented colloquium "Emergent Stochastic Oscillations and Signal Detection in Tree Networks of Excitable Elements" at College of Wooster (October 2017)⁸
* Received APS Student Travel Award from Division of Biological Physics (March 2019)⁸
* Editor for Brain Development section of "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health," which received 2024 PROSE Award¹
* Notable publications include:
  - "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge" in *Scientific Reports* (2022)²
  - "Long-lasting desynchronization of plastic neural networks by random reset stimulation" in *Frontiers in Physiology* (2021)²
  - "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements" in *Scientific Reports* (2017)²

**Online / Social Presence**

* Maintains personal website: [alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/)¹
* Presence on Frontiers Loop research network: [loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/bio](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/bio)⁸
* Google Scholar profile available³
* Listed as author on Amazon Science: [amazon.science/author/ali-khaledi](https://www.amazon.science/author/ali-khaledi)¹¹
* Medium blog with limited content¹
* No verified accounts located on Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram during search⁹

**Other Notable Information**

* Originally from Iran, moved to the United States in 2014¹
* Commits two hours daily to reading and coursework for continuous learning¹
* No affiliations with Omani academic institutions found⁵
* No patents or patent applications found in USPTO, EPO, or WIPO databases¹⁰
* No mentions found in Omani news outlets (Muscat Daily, Times of Oman, Oman Observer)⁷

### Risk Assessment

Based on the available OSINT data, Ali Khaledi-Nasab presents a consistent professional profile with verifiable academic achievements and employment history. No negative information, legal issues, or concerning activities were identified during this investigation.

---

**Citations:**
¹ Task 1: Personal website and professional background information
² Task 2: Research publications and areas of expertise
³ Task 3: Academic metrics and citation data
⁵ Task 5: Oman academic affiliations search
⁶ Task 6: Oman business registry search
⁷ Task 7: Omani news media search
⁸ Task 8: Conference presentations and academic talks
⁹ Task 9: Social media presence search
¹⁰ Task 10: Patent database search
¹¹ Task 11: University faculty directory search

For a comprehensive list of his publications, you can visit his Google Scholar profile. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

task_8.query_used: Search AI conference proceedings and speaker lists for Ali Khaledi Nasab presentations
task_8.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab has actively contributed to the field of physics through various presentations and publications. In October 2017, as a graduate student at Ohio University, he delivered a colloquium titled "Emergent Stochastic Oscillations and Signal Detection in Tree Networks of Excitable Elements" at the College of Wooster. His talk focused on the stochastic dynamics of tree networks of excitable elements, relevant to certain sensory neurons, and proposed mechanisms for tuning the activity of central elements in these networks. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

In March 2019, Khaledi-Nasab received a Student Travel Award from the American Physical Society's Division of Biological Physics, enabling him to present his research at the APS annual meeting in Boston. His presentation, "Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks: Application to Sensory Neurons," delved into the dynamical principles of sensory neurons with tree-like morphologies, such as those found in muscle spindles and mechanoreceptors. He utilized theoretical and computational approaches to explore spike generation and information coding in these neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

Beyond these presentations, Khaledi-Nasab has an extensive publication record, with 23 papers and 426 citations, reflecting his significant contributions to the field. ([exaly.com](https://exaly.com/author/5034433/ali-khaledi-nasab?utm_source=openai))

Currently, he serves as a Senior Researcher at Amazon in Seattle and is also affiliated with the Ronin Institute in Essex County, United States. ([loop.frontiersin.org](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/bio?utm_source=openai))

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Gives Colloquium Talk at College of Wooster - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_9.query_used: Search Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram for verified accounts or mentions of Ali Khaledi Nasab AI researcher
task_9.data:
I couldn't locate verified social media accounts or specific mentions of Dr. Ali Khaledi Nasab on Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram. However, Dr. Khaledi Nasab is an AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. He earned his Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University in 2019, where his research focused on the collective dynamics of excitable tree networks. Following his doctoral studies, he held a research position in the Department of Neurosurgery at Stanford University School of Medicine. In 2022, he joined Amazon as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team and later transitioned to Amazon Rufus in 2024 to work on generative AI products. Additionally, he serves as an adjunct professor of Physics at Ohio University. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Dr. Khaledi Nasab maintains a personal website where he shares his professional journey, research interests, and personal notes. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai)) His research contributions are also documented on his Google Scholar profile. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

For direct contact or to follow his updates, Dr. Khaledi Nasab provides contact information on his website. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/contact-ali?utm_source=openai))

task_12.query_used: Search ResearchGate and ORCID for collaboration networks and citation metrics of Ali Khaledi Nasab
task_12.data:
I couldn't locate specific profiles for Ali Khaledi Nasab on ResearchGate or ORCID based on the available information. It's possible that he may not have active profiles on these platforms, or his profiles are not publicly accessible.

In general, platforms like ResearchGate and ORCID are valuable for analyzing researchers' collaboration networks and citation metrics. ResearchGate allows users to view co-authorship connections, publication counts, and citation statistics, providing insights into a researcher's collaborative relationships and academic impact. ORCID offers a unique identifier for researchers, enabling the consolidation of their work across various platforms and databases, which facilitates the tracking of their scholarly output and collaborations.

For a comprehensive analysis of Ali Khaledi Nasab's collaboration networks and citation metrics, it would be beneficial to access his profiles on these platforms directly. If such profiles are unavailable, alternative approaches include searching for his publications in academic databases like Scopus or Web of Science, which often provide co-authorship information and citation counts.
